intro: Fimbristylis brevivaginata, commonly known as the short-vaginata sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that are often surrounded by bracts. Its botanical characteristics include a compact growth habit and a preference for moist, well-drained soils. Fimbristylis brevivaginata is often found in swampy areas and can be an indicator species for wetland ecosystems.
